edu.rit.numeric

Class Bracket

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.numeric.Bracket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BracketMonotonic

    public abstract class Bracket
extends Object
    Class Bracket is the abstract base class for an object that finds a bracketing interval for a root of a Function. Given a real-valued function of a real-valued variable f(x), an instance of a subclass of class Bracket finds values x1 and x2 such that f(x1) and f(x2) have opposite signs. Class Root uses class Bracket.

      • Bracket

        public Bracket(double x1,
       double x2)
        Construct a bracketing interval object with the initial bracketing interval x1 to x2.
        Parameters:
        x1 - Initial bracketing interval first endpoint.

    • Method Detail

      • bracket

        public abstract void bracket(Function func)
        Find a bracketing interval for the given function. When called, fields x1 and x2 are the initial bracketing interval endpoints. Upon return, fields x1 and x2 have been adjusted to bracket a root; fields f_x1 and f_x2 contain the function values at x1 and x2; and f_x1 and f_x2 have opposite signs.
        Parameters:
        func - Function.
        Throws:
        TooManyIterationsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if too many iterations have occurred without finding a bracketing interval.
